Description: Copper alloy sheathing tack, with broken shank. Square cross section shank. Residues of lead and lead corrosion products(?) and pitch(?) adhere to underside of tack.
Curator's comments: Hull sheathing tack used to attach hull sheathing to the hull of ships. Technology commonly associated with Greco-Roman ships in the Mediterranean and the Red Sea from the 5th century BC to the 3rd century AD. Slightly different form to those commonly used in the Roman period, so more likely to be Hellenistic in date.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TC.13)
